member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.ComHelper
member.summary: Provides methods for COM clients to load a document into Aspose.Pdf.
member.remarks: Use the ComHelper class to load a document from a file or stream into a Document object in a COM application. The Document class provides a default constructor to create a new document and also provides overloaded constructors to load a document from a file or stream. If you are using Aspose.Words from a .NET application, you can use all of the Document constructors directly, but if you are using Aspose.Pdf from a COM application, only the default Document constructor is available.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains the width of columns. The value of each column should be separated by blank.The default unit is point, but cm, inch and percentage of available width are also supported. For example,"120 2.5cm 1.5inch"

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.ColumnInfo.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains the spacing between columns. The value of each spacing should be separated by blank. The default unit is point, but cm and inch are also supported.For example,"120 2.5cm 1.5inch".
member.remarks: If this property is not set, default value 1.25cm will be used for each spacing.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.AlignText
member.summary: This flag controls text alignment in converted document. By default document conversion doesn't affect text alignment and leave text as is. But in some cases font substitution causes text overlapping or extra spaces in converted document. When this flag is set special alignment operations will be performed. This flag should be set only for documents which have problems with overlapped text or extra text spaces cause using of this flag decrease performance and in some cases could corrupt text content.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.PuaTextProcessingStrategy
member.summary: Strategy to process symbols from unicode Private Use Area (PUA).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.OptimizeFileSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag which enables/disables special conversion mode to get PDF/A document with reduced file size. Now this flag impacts on optimization of fonts used in PDF document, possibly, in future, this flag also will be used to switch on optimization for another data structures, such as graphic. Set of this flag and mode could significantly reduce file size but at the same time it could significantly decrease performance of conversion.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.ExcludeFontsStrategy
member.summary: Strategy(ies) to exclude superfluous fonts and reduce document file size. This parameter has sense only when flag is set to true. By default combination of strategies and is used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.FontEmbeddingOptions
member.summary: Options for cases when it's not possible to embed some fonts into PDF document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.UnicodeProcessingRules
member.summary: Rules to solve problems with unicode mapping. Can be null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.IccProfileFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the filename of icc profile name. In case of null the default icc profile used.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.SegmentAlignStrategy
member.summary: Describes strategies used to align document text segments. Now only strategy to restore segments to original bounds is supported. In future another strategies could be added.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.PuaProcessingStrategy
member.summary: Some PDF documents have special unicode symbols, which are belonged to Private Use Area (PUA), see description at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Private_Use_Areas. This symbols cause an PDF/A compliant errors like "Text is mapped to Unicode Private Use Area but no ActualText entry is present". This enumeration declares a strategies which can be used to handle PUA symbols.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.PuaProcessingStrategy.None
member.summary: Disable PUA symbol processing. This strategy used by default for PDF/A documents with Level B conformance.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.PuaProcessingStrategy.SurroundPuaTextWithEmptyActualText
member.summary: Inserts marked content block with ActualText entry which contains empty text. This strategy gives good results for documents without marked content blocks. Used by default for PDF/A documents with Level A conformance.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.PuaProcessingStrategy.SubstitutePuaSymbols
member.summary: This strategy works slower than 'SurroundPuaTextWithEmptyActualText' but it can remove PUA compliant errors for documents which can't be handled properly by SurroundPuaTextWithEmptyActualText. PUA symbols are substituted on symbol 'space' or special unicode (some PUA symbols have unicode analogs). Substitution applied not to document's text but to font's internal data ToUnicode so it doesn't affects symbol's vision but it affects symbol's presentation in copy/paste operation system buffer.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.RemoveFontsStrategy
member.summary: Some documens have large size after converison into PDF/A format. To reduce file size for these documents it's necessary to define a strategy of fonts removing. This enumeration declares a strategies which can be used to optimize fonts usage. Every strategy from this enumeration has sense only when flag is set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.RemoveFontsStrategy.RemoveDuplicatedFonts
member.summary: This strategy removes all the fonts which have duplicates in document. If document contains group of duplicated fonts only one font from this group is embedded in document. All other fonts from this group are removed from document, every removed font substituted with the already embedded analog.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.RemoveFontsStrategy.RemoveSimilarFontsWithDifferentWidths
member.summary: This strategy looks like but it removes not fully duplicated fonts but fonts which are similar one to another and differs only by parameter "Widths". This parameter contains set of some widths for specified symbols of font. Every value of width from this "Widths" set is not the real width of symbol(glyph), real width for this symbol already defined in font's binary data. Value of width from "Widths" set means visual width for this symbol - the width which PDF viewer software must set on displaying symbol instead of real width defined in the font. More accurately specification tells: Acrobat 5.0 and later viewers use the glyph widths stored in the font dictionary to override the widths of glyphs in the font program itself, which improves the consistency of the display and printing of the document. This strategy is more effective than but using of this strategy in some cases theoretically could damage visual presentation of converted document. This defect is possible due to that declared widths of fonts could be different for the same symbol and in this case width of this symbol will be changed to new one after font substitution - when removed font will be replaced in document with already embedded one. And if symbol's visual width will be changed - it will be shown incorrectly and this distinction could cause visual defects such as text overlapping or another problems. But visual defect described is a very rare case and this strategy reduces size of document more effectively.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PdfFormatConversionOptions.RemoveFontsStrategy.SubsetFonts
member.summary: This is most effective strategy to reduce document's size. It takes fully embedded font sets and trim them down to only the subsets used. It's recommended to use this strategy in combination with or to get multiple compression effect for file size. Using of all three strategies simultaneously has no sense and strategy will not be used in this case.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.PdfANonSpecificationFlags
member.summary: This class holds flags to control PDF/A conversion for cases when source PDF document doesn't correspond to PDF specification. If flags of this clas are used it decreases performance but it's necessary when source PDF document can't be convert into PDF/A format by usual way. By default all flags are set to false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PdfANonSpecificationFlags.CheckDifferentNamesInFontDictionaries
member.summary: Some PDF documents contain fonts which have different names in internal data. Use of this flag enforces special processing logic for cases when fields BaseFont and FontDescriptor.FontName are different.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.PdfASymbolicFontEncodingStrategy
member.summary: This class describes rules which can be used to tune process of copy encoding data for cases when TrueType symbolic font has more than one encoding. Some PDF documents after conversion into PDF/A format could have error "More than one encoding in symbolic TrueType font's cmap". What is a reason of this error? All TrueType symbolic fonts have special table "cmap" in it's internal data. This table maps character codes to glyph indices. And this table could contain different encoding subtables which describe encodings used. See advanced info about cmap tables at https://developer.apple.com/fonts/TrueType-Reference-Manual/RM06/Chap6cmap.html. Usually cmap table contains several encoding subtables, but PDF/A standard requires that only one encoding subtable (3,0) must be leaved for this font in PDF/A document. And key question here - what data must be taken from another subtables to copy into destination encoding table (3,0)? Majority of fonts have 'well-formed' cmap tables where every encoding subtable is fully consistent with another subtable. But some fonts have cmap tables with collisions - where for example one subtable has glyph index 100 for unicode 100, but another subtable has glyph index 200 for the same unicode 100. To solve this problems special strategy needed. By default following strategy used: mac subtable(1,0) is looked for. If this table is found, only this data used to fill destination table (3,0). If mac subtable is not found then all subtables except (3,0) are iterated and used to copy data into destination (3,0) subtable. Also mapping for every unicode(unicode, glyph index) is copied into destination table only if destination table has no this unicode at current moment. So, for example if first subtabe has glyph index 100 for unicode 100, and next subtable has glyph index 200 for the same unicode 100, only data from first subtable (unicode=100, glyph index = 100) will be copied. So each previous subtable takes precedence over the next. Properties of this class help tune default behaviour. If property of type is set, then relevant subtable will be used in precedence to mac subtable(1,0). Value 'MacTable' from enumeration has no sense in this case, cause it points on the same mac subtable (1,0) which will be used by default. Property discards all priorities for any subtable. If this property is set, then only subtables from declared queue will be used in specified order. If subtables specified are not found then default iteration of all subtables and copy strategy described above will be used. Object specifies encoding subtable used. This subtable can be set via combination of members(PlatformID, PlatformSpecificID) or via enumeration.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Forms.DocMDPAccessPermissions
member.summary: The access permissions granted for this document. Valid values are: 1 - No changes to the document are permitted; any change to the document invalidates the signature. 2 - Permitted changes are filling in forms, instantiating page templates, and signing; other changes invalidate the signature. 3 - Permitted changes are the same as for 2, as well as annotation creation, deletion, and modification; other changes invalidate the signature.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Forms.DocMDPAccessPermissions.NoChanges
member.summary: 1 - No changes to the document are permitted; any change to the document invalidates the signature.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Forms.DocMDPAccessPermissions.FillingInForms
member.summary: 2 - Permitted changes are filling in forms, instantiating page templates, and signing; other changes invalidate the signature.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Forms.DocMDPAccessPermissions.AnnotationModification
member.summary: 3 - Permitted changes are the same as for 2, as well as annotation creation, deletion, and modification; other changes invalidate the signature.

member.summary: This class represents set of data that related to external resource file's saving that occures during conversion of PDF to some other format (f.e. HTML)

member.summary: Set by converter. Supposed file name that goes from converter to code of custom method Can be use in custom code to decide how to process or where save that file

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.SaveOptions.ResourceSavingInfo.ContentStream
member.summary: Set by converter. Represents binary content of saved file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.SaveOptions.ResourceSavingInfo.CustomProcessingCancelled
member.summary: this flag must set to "true" in custom code if for some reasons proposed file should be processed not with custom code but with converter's code itself in standard for converter way. So, it' setting set to true means that custom code did not process referenced file and converter must handle it itself (in both sences - for saving somewhere and for naming in referencing file).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.SaveOptions.ResourceSavingInfo.ResourceType
member.summary: Set by converter. Supposed file name that goes from converter to code of custom method Can be use in custom code to decide how to process or where save that file

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.ExcelSaveOptions.MinimizeTheNumberOfWorksheets
member.summary: Set true if you need to minimize the number of worksheets in resultant workbook. Default value is false; it means save of each PDF page as separated worksheet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.ExcelSaveOptions.InsertBlankColumnAtFirst
member.summary: Set false if you need suppress inserting of blank column as the first column of worksheet. Default value is true; it means that blank column will be inserted.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.ExcelSaveOptions.UniformWorksheets
member.summary: Set true for using uniform columns division through the document. Default value is false; it means that columns division will independent for each page.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.ExcelSaveOptions.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets factor that will be applied to (virtual) scaling font size during conversion to Excel table. Setting of less value facilitates the search for columns and prevents merging of them for some documents. Default value is 0.9; Setting value to zero allows algorithm choose scaling automatically.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Text.CustomFontSubstitutionBase
member.summary: Represents a base class for custom font substitution strategy.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Text.FontSubstitution
member.summary: Represents a base class fot font substitution strategies.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Text.CustomFontSubstitutionBase.TrySubstitute(Aspose.Pdf.Text.CustomFontSubstitutionBase.OriginalFontSpecification,Aspose.Pdf.Text.Font@)
member.summary: Substitutes original font with another font.
member.remarks:
The class CustomFontSubstitutionBase should be inherited to implement custom font substitution logic. TrySubstitute method should be overridden properly:
Must return true in case substitution is required. substitutionFont must be set to valid Font object. Must return false in case no substitution is required. substitutionFont may be set to null.
member.returns: True in case substitution was successfull.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Text.CustomFontSubstitutionBase.OriginalFontSpecification
member.summary: Represents original font specification.
member.remarks: Provides info related to original font such as , flag. Also provides flag that helps to check is the substitution will anyway happen with the font and the user may override the default substitution logic.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Text.CustomFontSubstitutionBase.OriginalFontSpecification.OriginalFontName
member.summary: Gets original font name.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Text.CustomFontSubstitutionBase.OriginalFontSpecification.IsEmbedded
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the font is embedded.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Text.CustomFontSubstitutionBase.OriginalFontSpecification.IsSubstitutionUnavoidable
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates that the substitution is unavoidable.
member.remarks:
Returns true in case substitution was requested because of absence of the original font or in case original font cannot be used in context of some task. In case user ignores the flag and doesn't substitute the font - default font substitution procedure is performed. But it provides opportunity for the user to alternate standard font substitution procedure and set better font to the system.
Returns false in case original font is present, valid, but it is allowed for the user to substitute it.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Text.IFontOptions
member.summary: Useful properties to tune Font behaviour

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Text.IFontOptions.NotifyAboutFontEmbeddingError
member.summary: Sometimes it's not possible to embed desired font into document. There are many reasons, for example license restrictions or when desired font was not found on destination computer. When this situation comes it's not simply to detect, because desired font is embedded via set of property flag Font.IsEmbedded = true; Of course it's possible to read this property immediately after it was set but it's not convenient approach. Flag NotifyAboutFontEmbeddingError enforces exception mechanism for cases when attempt to embed font became failed. If this flag is set an exception of type will be thrown. By default false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Text.TextFragment
member.summary: Represents fragment of Pdf text.
member.remarks:
In a few words, object contains list of objects.
In details: Text of pdf document in is represented by two basic objects: and
The differences between them is mostly context-dependent.
Let's consider following scenario. User searches text "hello world" to operate with it, change it's properties, look etc.
Document doc = new Document(docFile); TextFragmentAbsorber absorber = new TextFragmentAbsorber("hello world"); doc.Pages[1].Accept(absorber);
Phisycally pdf text's representation is very complex. The text "hello world" may consist of several phisycally independent text segments.
The Aspose.Pdf text model basically establishes that object provides single logic operation set over physical objects set that represent user's query.
In text search scenario, is logical "hello world" text representation, and object collection represents all physical segments that construct "hello world" text object.
So, is close to logical text representation. And is close to physical text representation.
Obviously each object may have it's own font, coloring, positioning properties.
provides simple way to change text with it's properties: set font, set font size, set font color etc. Meanwhile objects are accessible and users are able to operate with objects independently.
Note that changing TextFragment properties may change inner collection because TextFragment is an aggregate object and it may rearrange internal segments or merge them into single segment. If your requirement is to leave the collection unchanged, please change inner segments individually.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.UnifiedSaveOptions
member.summary: This class represents saving options for saving that uses unified conversion way (with unified internal document model)

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.UnifiedSaveOptions.TryMergeAdjacentSameBackgroundImages
member.summary: Sometimes PDFs contain background images (of pages or table cells) constructed from several same tiling background images put one near other. In such case renderers of target formats (f.e MsWord for DOCS format) sometimes generates visible boundaries beetween parts of background images, cause their techniques of image edge smoothing (anti-aliasing) is different from Acrobat Reader. If it looks like exported document contains such visible boundaries between parts of same background images, please try use this setting to get rid of that unwanted effect. ATTENTION! This optimization of quality usually essentially slows down conversion, so, please, use this option only when it's really necessary.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.UnifiedSaveOptions.ExtractOcrSublayerOnly
member.summary: This atrribute turned on functionality for extracting image or text for PDF documents with OCR sublayer.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlDocumentType
member.summary: Represents enumeration of the Html document types.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlDocumentType.Xhtml
member.summary: The XHtml Document Type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlDocumentType.Html5
member.summary: The HTML5 Document Type.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions
member.summary: Save options for export to Html format

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CustomProgressHandler
member.summary: This handler can be used to handle conversion progress events f.e. it can be used to show progress bar or messages about current amount of processed pages, example of handler's code that shows progress on console is :

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.AntialiasingProcessing
member.summary: This parameter defines required antialiasing measures during conversion of compound background images from PDF to HTML

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.SaveTransparentTexts
member.summary: Pdf can contain transparent texts that can be selected to clipboard (usually it happen when document contains images and OCRed texts extracted from it). This settings tells to converter whether we need save such texts as transparent selectable texts in result HTML

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.SaveShadowedTextsAsTransparentTexts
member.summary: Pdf can contain texts that are shadowed by another elements (f.e. by images) but can be selected to clipboard in Acrobat Reader (usually it happen when document contains images and OCRed texts extracted from it). This settings tells to converter whether we need save such texts as transparent selectable texts in result HTML to mimic behaviour of Acrobat Reader (othervise such texts are usually saved as hidden, not available for copying to clipboard)

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontSavingMode
member.summary: Defines font saving mode that will be used during saving of PDF to desirable format

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.PageBorderIfAny
member.summary: This attribute represents set of settings used for drawing border (if any) in result HTML document around area that represent source PDF page. In essence it concerns of showing of page's paper edges, not page border referenced in PDF page itself.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.LettersPositioningMethod
member.summary: Sets mode of positioning of letters in words in result HTML

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.ExplicitListOfSavedPages
member.summary: With this property You can explicitely define what pages of document should be converted. Pages in this list must have 1-based numbers. I.e. valid numbers of pages must be taken from range (1...[NumberOfPagesInConvertedDocument]) Order of appearing of pages in this list does not affect their order in result HTML page(s) - in result pages allways will go in order in which they are present in source PDF. If this list is null (as it is by default), all pages will be converted. If any page number of this list will go out of range of present pages(1-[amountOfPagesInDocument]) exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CustomResourceSavingStrategy
member.summary: This field can contain saving strategy that must be used (if present) during conversion for customized handling of created referenced resource files (like images and fonts) related to nodes of saved HTML. That strategy must process resources and return string that represents desirable URL of saved resource in generated HTML.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CustomCssSavingStrategy
member.summary: This field can contain saving strategy that must be used (if present) during conversion of Pdf to Html for handling of saving of CSSes related to created HTML document as whole or to it's pages(if several HTMLpages are generated) If You want handle CSS file in some specific way, that just please create relevant method and assign delegate created from it to this property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CustomHtmlSavingStrategy
member.summary: Result of conversion can contain one or several HTML-pages You can assign to this property delegate created from custom method that implements processing of one HTML-page(to be accurately - markup-HTML, without exteranl linked files if any) that was created during conversion. In such case processing (like saving of paage's HTML in stream or disk) can be done in that custom code . In such case all the necessary actions for saving of HTML page must be undertaken in code of supplied method, because saving of result in code of converter will be not in use . If processing for this or that case for some reason must be done by converter's code itself, not in custom code, please set in custom code flag 'CustomProcessingCancelled' of 'htmlSavingInfo' parameter's variable : it will signal to converter that all the necessary steps for processing of that resource must be done in converter itself in same way as if there was no any external custom code for procesing .

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CustomStrategyOfCssUrlCreation
member.summary: This field can contain custom method that returns URL (Or URL template if multipage generation is on - see details below) of subject CSS as it should be put in generated result HTML. F.e. if You want converter put some specific URL instead of standard CSS file name into generated CSS, then You should just create and put into this property method that generates desirable URL. If flag 'SplitCssIntoPages' set, then this custom strategy (if any) must return not exact URL of CSS but rather template string that (after substitution of placeholder with page number with string.Format() function inside converter) can be resolved into URL for this or that page's CSS' URL. Examples of expected return string in such case are: 'SomeTargetLocation-page_{0}.css','../PartHandlers/GetCss.aspx?DocumentId=45654&CssPage={0}')

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.#ctor(Aspose.Pdf.HtmlDocumentType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: if set to true HTML is created as fixed layout.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.#ctor(Aspose.Pdf.HtmlDocumentType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: if set to true HTML is created as fixed layout.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.SpecialFolderForSvgImages
member.summary: Gets or sets path to directory to which must be saved only SVG-images if they are encountered during saving of document as HTML. If parameter is empty or null then SVG files(if any) wil be saved together with other image-files (near to output file) or in special folder for images (if it specified in SpecialImagesFolderIfAny option). It does not affect anything if CustomImageSavingStrategy property was successfully used to process relevant image file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.SpecialFolderForAllImages
member.summary: Gets or sets path to directory to which must be saved any images if they are encountered during saving of document as HTML. If parameter is empty or null then image files(if any) wil be saved together with other files linked to HTML It does not affect anything if CustomImageSavingStrategy property was successfully used to process relevant image file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CssClassNamesPrefix
member.summary: When PDFtoHTML converter generates result CSSs, CSS class names (something like ".stl_01 {}" ... ".stl_NN {}) are generated and used in result CSS. This property allows forcibly set class name prefix For example, if You want that all class names start with 'my_prefix_' (i.e. were something like 'my_prefix_1' ... 'my_prefix_NNN' ) , then just assign 'my_prefix_' to this property before conversion. If this property will stay untouched(i.e. null will be leaved as value ), then converter will generate class names itself (it wil be something like ".stl_01 {}" ... ".stl_NN {}")

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.PartsEmbeddingMode
member.summary: It defines whether referenced files (HTML, Fonts,Images, CSSes) will be embedded into main HTML file or will be generated as apart binary entities

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlMarkupGenerationMode
member.summary: Sometimes specific reqirments to generation of HTML markup are present. This parameter defines HTML preparing modes that can be used during conversion of PDF to HTML to match such specific requirments.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.RasterImagesSavingMode
member.summary: Converted PDF can contain raster images This parameter defines how they should be handled during conversion of PDF to HTML

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.RemoveEmptyAreasOnTopAndBottom
member.summary: Defines whether in created HTML will be removed top and bottom empty area without any content (if any).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontEncodingStrategy
member.summary: Defines encoding special rule to tune PDF decoding for current document

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.PagesFlowTypeDependsOnViewersScreenSize
member.summary: If attribute 'SplitOnPages=false', than whole HTML representing all input PDF pages will be put into one big result HTML file. This flag defines whether result HTML will be generated in such way that flow of areas that represent PDF pages in result HTML will depend on screen resolution of viewer. Suppose width of screen on viewer side is big enough to put 2 or more pages one near other in horizontal direction. If this flag set to true, then this opportunity will be used (as many pages will be shown in horizontal direction one near another as it possible, then next horizontal group of pages will be shown under first one ). Otherwise pages will flow in such way: next page goes always under previous one.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.TrySaveTextUnderliningAndStrikeoutingInCss
member.summary: PDF itself does not contain underlining markers for texts. It emulated with line situated under text. This option allows converter try guess that this or that line is a text's underlining and put this info into CSS instead of drawing of underlining graphically

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.DocumentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the .

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CompressSvgGraphicsIfAny
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that indicates whether found SVG graphics(if any) will be compressed(zipped) into SVGZ format during saving

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.SplitCssIntoPages
member.summary: When multipage-mode selected(i.e 'SplitIntoPages' is 'true'), then this attribute defines whether should be created separate CSS-file for each result HTML page. By default this attribute is false, so, will be created one big common CSS for all created pages. Summary size of all CSSes generated in this mode(one CSS per page) usually much more than size of one big CSS file, because in former case CSS classes are duplicates in such case in several CSS files for each page. So, this setting is worse to be used only when You are interested in future processing of each HTML page independently, and therefore size of CSS of each one page taken apart is the most critical issue.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.SplitIntoPages
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that indicates whether each page of source document will be converted into it's own target HTML document, i.e whether result HTML will be splitted into several HTML-pages.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FixedLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether that HTML is created as fixed layout.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.ImageResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets resolution for image rendering.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontSources
member.summary: Font sources of pre-saved fonts.
member.remarks: Fonts may be saved preliminarily for cache purpose and then passed into Html conversion process. For example it may be useful in document splitting scenario and processing document pages in multiple threads with single set of fonts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.AdditionalMarginWidthInPoints
member.summary: If attribute 'SplitOnPages=false', than whole HTML representing all input PDF pages wont be not split into different HTML pages, but will be put into one big result HTML file. But each source PDF page will be represented with it's own rectangle area in HTML (if necessary that areas can be bordered to show page paper edges with special attribute 'PageBorderIfAny'. This parameter defines width of margin that will be forcibly left around that output HTML-areas that represent pages of source PDF document.In essence it defines guaranteed interval between HTML-representations of PDF "paper" pages such mode of conversion.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.UseZOrder
member.summary: If attribute UseZORder set to true, graphics and text are added to resultant HTML document accordingly Z-order in original PDF document. If this attribute is false all graphics is put as single layer which may cause some unnecessary effects for overlapped objects.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.MinimalLineWidth
member.summary: This attribute sets minimal width of graphic path line. If thickness of line is less than 1px Adobe Acrobat rounds it to this value. So this attribute can be used to emulate this behavior for HTML browsers.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.PreventGlyphsGrouping
member.summary: This attribute switch on the mode when text glyphs will not be grouped into words and strings This mode allows to keep maximum precision during positioning of glyphs on the page and it can be used for conversion documents with music notes or glyphs that should be placed separately each other. This parameter will be applied to document only when the value of FixedLayout attribute is true.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontSavingModes
member.summary: Enumerates modes that can be used for saving of fonts referenced in saved PDF

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontSavingModes.AlwaysSaveAsWOFF
member.summary: All referenced fonts will be saved and referenced as WOFF-fonts

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontSavingModes.AlwaysSaveAsTTF
member.summary: All referenced fonts will be saved and referenced as TTF-fonts

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontSavingModes.AlwaysSaveAsEOT
member.summary: All referenced fonts will be saved and referenced as EOT-fonts

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontSavingModes.SaveInAllFormats
member.summary: All referenced fonts will be saved (and referenced in CSS) as 3 independent files : EOT, TTH,WOFF. It increases size of output data but makes output sutable for overhelming majority of web brawsers

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.AntialiasingProcessingType
member.summary: This enum describes possible antialiasing measures during conversion

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.AntialiasingProcessingType.NoAdditionalProcessing
member.summary: no special antialiasing processing in use. This is an optimal option for overhelming majority of documents and it does not require additional time during conversion

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CssSavingInfo
member.summary: This class represents set of data that related to custom saving of CSS during conversion of PDF to HTML format

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CssSavingInfo.CssNumber
member.summary: Set by converter. During conversion several CSS-files are created . This properties shows ordinal of saved CSS-file during conversion. It can be used in logic of custom code to decide how to process or where to save CSS content

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CssSavingInfo.SupposedURL
member.summary: Set by converter. Supposed file name that goes from converter to code of custom method Can be used in custom code to decide how to process or where to save content

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CssSavingInfo.ContentStream
member.summary: Set by converter. Represents binary content of saved CSS

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlPageMarkupSavingInfo
member.summary: If SplitToPages property of HtmlSaveOptions, then several HTML-files (one HTML file per converted page) are created during conversion of PDF to HTML. This class represents set of data that related to custom saving of one HTML-page's markup during conversion of PDF to HTML

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlPageMarkupSavingInfo.SupposedFileName
member.summary: Set by converter. Supposed file name that goes from converter to code of custom method Can be used in custom code to decide how to process or where to save content

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlPageMarkupSavingInfo.ContentStream
member.summary: Set by converter. Represents saved HTML as stream

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlPageMarkupSavingInfo.PdfHostPageNumber
member.summary: Set by converter. If SplitToPages property set, then several HTML-files(one HTML file per converted page) are created during conversion created . This property tells to custom code from what page of original PDF was created saved HTML-markup. If original page number for some reason is inknown or SplitOnPages=false,then this property allways contains '0' that signals that converter cannot supply exact original PDF's page number for supplied HTML-markup file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlPageMarkupSavingInfo.HtmlHostPageNumber
member.summary: Set by converter. If set SplitToPages property, then several HTML-files(one HTML file per converted page) are created during conversion created . This property contains ordinal of saved HTML page's file. The property can be used in logic of custom code to decide how to process or where to save HTML page and If splitting on pages turned off this value always contains '1' since in such case only one big HTML page is generated for whole source document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlPageMarkupSavingInfo.CustomProcessingCancelled
member.summary: Should be set in custom code when necessary. This flag must be set to "true" in custom code if for some reasons supplied html-markup should be processed not with custom code but with converter's code itself in standard for converter way. So, setting if this flag in custom code means that custom code did not process referenced file and converter must handle it itself

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CssUrlRequestInfo
member.summary: Represents set of data that related to request from converter to custom code aimed to get desirable URL (or URL template)of subject CSS

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CssUrlRequestInfo.CustomProcessingCancelled
member.summary: Should be set by custom code if it cannot or should not define URL that will be used in generated HTML for referencing of that CSS. If it's 'true', then CSS file will be saved in standard way in standard place.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.LettersPositioningMethods
member.summary: It enumerates possible modes of positioning of letters in words in result HTML

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.LettersPositioningMethods.UseEmUnitsAndCompensationOfRoundingErrorsInCss
member.summary: It's default method. It uses EM-units and special alhorithm of compensation of rounding errors It's preferable for usage in IE10.0 and more fresh versions and gives better scaling of captions when scaling is necessary

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.LettersPositioningMethods.UsePixelUnitsInCssLetterSpacingForIE
member.summary: It allows to get sometimes more precise results in old IE browser versions

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageSavingInfo
member.summary: This class represents set of data that related to external resource image file's saving during PDF to HTML conversion.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageSavingInfo.ImageType
member.summary: Represents type of saved image referenced in HTML. Set by converter and can be used in custom code to decide what should be done

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageSavingInfo.ParentType
member.summary: Saved image can pertain to HTML itself or can be extracted. from SVG embedded to HTML. This property can tell to custom code what's that type of parent of processed image. It set by converter and can be used in custom code to decide what should be done with that image (f.e. custom code can decide where to save image or how it must be referenced in parent's content).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageSavingInfo.PdfHostPageNumber
member.summary: Tells to custom code to what page of original PDF document pertains saved image Since it's possible that will be saved not all pages of original document, this value tells us about host page number in original PDF. If original page number for some reason is inknown, it allways return '1'

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageSavingInfo.HtmlHostPageNumber
member.summary: Tells to custom code to what page of generated set of HTML page-files pertains saved image. If splitting on pages turned off this value always contains '1' since in such case Only one HTML page is generated.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.ResourceSavingStrategy
member.summary: To this property You can assign delegate created from custom method that implements processing of external resource(Font or Image) that was extracted from PDF and must be saved as external resource during conversion of PDF to HTML. In such case processing (like saving in stream or disk) can be done in that custom code and that custom code must return path(or any another string without quotemarks) that will be afterwards incorporated into generated HTML instead of original supposed path to that image resource. In such case All the necessary actions for saving of image must be undertaken in code of supplied method, because saving of result in code of converter will be not in use . If processing for this or that file for some reason must be done by converter's code itself, not in custom code, please set in custom code flag 'CustomProcessingCancelled' of 'resourceSavingInfo' parameter's variable It signals to converter that all the necessary steps for processing of that resource must be done in converter itself as if there was no any external custom code .
member.param: represents set of data for saving of resource
member.returns: must return URL to saved resource that will be used during generation of HTML

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlPageMarkupSavingStrategy
member.summary: Result of conversion can contain one or several HTML-pages ( that also can reference external files like images or fonts) You can assign to this property delegate created from custom method that implements processing of got HTML-page(HTML itself) that was created during conversion. In such case processing (like saving in stream or disk) can be done in that custom code . In such case All the necessary actions for saving of HTML page's markup must be undertaken in code of supplied method, because saving of result in code of converter will be not in use. If processing for this or that case for some reason must be done by converter's code itself, not in custom code, please set in custom code flag 'CustomProcessingCancelled' of 'htmlSavingInfo' parameter's variable : it signals to converter that all the necessary steps for processing of that resource must be done in converter itself in same way as if there was no any external custom saving code .
member.param: represents data that can be used for saving or processing of supplied HTML page

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CssSavingStrategy
member.summary: You can assign to this property custom strategy that implements processing or/and saving of one CSS's part that was created during conversion of PDF to HTML . In such case processing (like saving to stream or disk) must be done in that custom code
member.param: represents set of data that can be used for saving of supplied CSS part

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.CssUrlMakingStrategy
member.summary: You can assign to this property delegate created from custom method that implements creation of URL of CSS referenced in generated HTML document. F.e. if You want to make CSS referenced in HTML f.e. as "otherPage.ASPX?CssID=zjjkklj" Then such custom strategy must return "otherPage.ASPX?CssID=zjjkklj"
member.param: represents set of data that can be used for generation of CSS' URL
member.returns: must return string that represents CSS's URL or URL's template

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageType
member.summary: enumerates possible types of image files that can be saved as external resources during Pdf to Html conversion

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageType.Jpeg
member.summary: Jpeg format

member.summary: Png format

member.summary: Bmp format

member.summary: Gif format

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageType.Tiff
member.summary: Tiff format

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageType.Svg
member.summary: Svg format

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageType.ZippedSvg
member.summary: Zipped Svg format

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlImageType.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown - means that converter cannot detect type of content itself

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.ImageParentTypes
member.summary: Enumerates possible types of image's parents Image can pertain to HTML page or to SVG parent image

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.ImageParentTypes.HtmlPage
member.summary: Image pertains to HTML page itself

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.ImageParentTypes.SvgImage
member.summary: Image was embedded in SVG image

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.RasterImagesSavingModes
member.summary: Converted PDF can contain raster images(.png, *.jpeg etc.) This enum defines methods of how raster images can be handled during conversion of PDF to HTML

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.RasterImagesSavingModes.AsPngImagesEmbeddedIntoSvg
F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.RasterImagesSavingModes.AsExternalPngFilesReferencedViaSvg
member.summary: distinct raster images will be put apart as PNG files but will be referenced through wrapping SVG images, i.e. will be generated one PNG file and one SVG for each raster image, and each of such SVGs will contain links to relevant PNG file

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.RasterImagesSavingModes.AsEmbeddedPartsOfPngPageBackground
member.summary: Will be generated one big PNG background file for each result page. Raster images will be embedded into that file and rendered as regions of that image. No external PNG files for each image will be generated, only one PNG file per page will be present in conversion result set of files.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlMarkupGenerationModes
member.summary: Sometimes specific reqirments to created HTML are present. This enum defines HTML preparing modes that can be used during conversion of PDF to HTML to match such specific requirments.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlMarkupGenerationModes.WriteAllHtml
member.summary: Default mode any specific requirments are absent. Will be generated output that will contain all parts of HTML without any special additional processing.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlMarkupGenerationModes.WriteOnlyBodyContent
member.summary: will be stripped away all HTML content that is outside HTML's body, i.e. will be left only content that is inside tags

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.PartsEmbeddingModes
member.summary: This enum enumerates possible modes of embedding of files referenced in HTML It allows to control whether referenced files (HTML, Fonts,Images, CSSes) will be embedded into main HTML file or will be generated as apart binary entities

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.PartsEmbeddingModes.EmbedAllIntoHtml
member.summary: Enforces embed all referenced files(Css,Images,Fonts) into generated HTML markup (i.e. into HTML itself) This approach generates one HTML file, but total size of output becames bigger(because Base64 encoding of binaries is in use) and not all browsers (especially legacy) successfully process binaries embedded into HTML. But it allows get HTML that contains whole result, without any additional files.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.PartsEmbeddingModes.EmbedCssOnly
member.summary: Enforces put apart all referenced files except CSS (Images and Fonts) I.e. CSS will be embedded into result HTML , and all other referenced files(Images and Fonts) will be processed as external parts It generates HTML that is sutable for wide set of browsers

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.PartsEmbeddingModes.NoEmbedding
member.summary: Enforces put apart referenced files(Css,Images,Fonts) This approach generates set of files, but total size of output becames smaller(because no Base64 encoding of binaries is in use) Also such approach generates HTML that is sutable for wide set of browsers

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontEncodingRules
member.summary: This enumeration defines rules which tune encoding logic

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontEncodingRules.Default
member.summary: Leave encoding logic "as is" - in accordance with PDF specification

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.HtmlSaveOptions.FontEncodingRules.DecreaseToUnicodePriorityLevel
member.summary: ToUnicode is a special mechanism which helps to decode input codes to unicode symbols. According to specification it must be used first of all mechanisms to get unicode symbols for specific input code. But some documents has non-standard fonts and to convert these documents correctly it may be necessary to decrease ToUnicode priority and use another mechanisms to decode input codes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions
member.summary: LoadOptions type holds level of abstraction on individual load options

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.WarningHandler
member.summary: Callback to handle any warnings generated. The WarningHandler returns ReturnAction enum item specifying either Continue or Abort. Continue is the default action and the Load operation continues, however the user may also return Abort in which case the Load operation should cease.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.LoadFormat
member.summary: Represents file format which describes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.MarginsAreaUsageModes
member.summary: Represents mode of usage of margins area during conversion (like HTML, EPUB etc), defines treatement of instructions of imported format related to usage of margins.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.MarginsAreaUsageModes.PutContentOnMarginAreaIfNecessary
member.summary: In this mode converter obeyes format of imported document (f.e. CSS of imported HTML) in usage of margins area.So, if format of imported document requires usage of margins area for rendering , converter will allow that

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.MarginsAreaUsageModes.NeverPutContentOnMarginArea
member.summary: This mode strictly forbids usage of margins area, so, converter will never use area of margins for rendering, even if CSS or format of source document allows or requirs that

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.PageSizeAdjustmentModes
member.summary:
ATTENTION! The feature implemented but did not put yet to public API since blocker issue in OSHARED layer revealed for sample document.
Represents mode of usage of page size during conversion. Formats (like HTML, EPUB etc), usually have float design, so, it allows to fit required pagesize. But sometimes content has specifies horizontal positions or size that does not allow put content into required page size. In such case we can define what should be done in this case (i.e when size of content does not fit required initial page size of result PDF document).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.PageSizeAdjustmentModes.NoAjustmentAllwaysUsePredefinedSize
member.summary: In this mode result pages will have required pagesize defined in LoadOptions, no matter whether content after conversion goes out of page boundaries or no.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.PageSizeAdjustmentModes.EnlargeRequiredViewportWidthAndDoConversionAgain
member.summary: This mode defines such behaviour: after getting of conversion result , and detecting of fact that some content has been truncated, width of portview is enlarged to fit content and conversion is repeated. This mode allows getting of less pages in result in such case but requires repeated rendering(and therefore more processing time).

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingResult
member.summary: Result of custom loading of resource

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingResult.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates instance of loading result
member.param: reult of custom loading must be allways provided, it can be zero-length array if it's impossible to get any result

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingResult.EncodingIfKnown
member.summary: Sometimes encoding of resource is known after or during loading. In such case custom code can provide converter with that knowledge via this parameter. You can leave null in this parameter if encoding is unknown or does not matter.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingResult.ExceptionOfLoadingIfAny
member.summary: Sometimes it's impossible to load requested resource for some reason. Unavailability of resource often does not lead to crash of conversiov and result document can be created anyway(but maybe in a bit worse quality, without images etc.). If exception occured during loading, just catch it and put in this parameter - sometimes that information is usefull for converter for rendering of result.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingResult.MIMETypeIfKnown
member.summary: Sometimes knowledge about MIME type of loaded resource is usefull for converter You can provide MIME type(if it'd known after loading) in this parameter. Please leave parameter equal to null when MIME type unknown or it's not necessary to supply it.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingResult.LoadingCancelled
member.summary: Sometimes for some reasons loading should not occure custom code. In such case please set this flag as True. In such case converter will try use internal default resource loader to get that result(as it behave in situation when custom strategy not supplied).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingResult.Data
member.summary: Bynary data that loaded with custom loader - it must be set after loading

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingStrategy
member.summary: Sometimes it's necessary to avoid usage of internal loader of external resources(like images or CSSes) and supply custom method, that will get requested resources from somewhere. For example during usage of Aspose.Pdf in cloud direct access to referenced files impossible, and some custome code put into special method should be used. This delegate defines signature of such custom method.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.EmbedStandardFonts
member.summary: Property which declares that document must embed all standard Type1 fonts which has flag IsEmbedded set into true. All PDF fonts can be embedded into document simply via setting of flag IsEmbedded into true, but PDF standard Type1 fonts is an exception from this rule. Standard Type1 font embedding requires much time, so to embed these fonts it's necessary not only set flag IsEmbedded into true for specified font but also set an additiona flag on document's level - EmbedStandardFonts = true; This property can be set only one time for all fonts. By default false.

member.summary: Document metadata. (A PDF document may include general information, such as the document's title, author, and creation and modification dates. Such global information about the document (as opposed to its content or structure) is called metadata and is intended to assist in cataloguing and searching for documents in external databases.)

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.Background
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets optimization flag. When pages are added to document, equal resource streams in resultant file are merged into one PDF object if this flag set. This allows to decrease resultant file size but may cause slower execution and larger memory requirements. Default value: false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.AllowReusePageContent
member.summary: Allows to merge page contents to optimize docuement size. If used then differnet but duplicated pages may reference to the same content object. Please note that this mode may cause side effects like changing page content when other page is changed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.IgnoreCorruptedObjects
member.summary: Gets or sets flag of ignoring errors in source files. When pages from source document copied into destination document, copying process is stopped with exception if some objects in source files are corrupted when this flag is false. example: dest.Pages.Add(src.Pages); If this flag is set to true then corrupted objects will be replaced with empty values. By default: true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.PageLabels
member.summary: Gets page labels in the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.EnableObjectUnload
member.summary: Get or sets flag which enables document partially be unloaded from memory. This allow to decrease memory usage but may have negative effect on perofmance.

member.summary: Represents the method that will handle FontSubstitution event.

member.summary: Declares to subsets all the fonts, non-embedded and embedded both

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions
member.summary: Class which describes document optimization algorithm. Instance of this class may be used as parameter of OptimizeResources() method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.All
member.summary: Creates optimization strategy will all options activated.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.LinkDuplcateStreams
member.summary: If this flag is set to true, Resource streams will be analyzed. If duplicate streams are found (i.e. if stream contents is equal), then thes streams will be stored as one object. This allows to decrease document size in some cases (for example, when same document was concatenedted multiple times).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.AllowReusePageContent
member.summary: If true page contents will be reused when document is optimized for equal pages.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.RemoveUnusedStreams
member.summary: If this flag set to true, every resource is checked on it's usage. If resource is never used, then resources is removed. This may decrease document size for example when pages were extracted from document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.RemoveUnusedObjects
member.summary: If this flag is set to true, all document objects will be checked and unused objects (i.e. objects which does not have any reference) are removed from document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.CompressImages
member.summary: If this flag is set to true images will be compressed in the document. compression level is specfied with ImageQuality property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.ResizeImages
member.summary: If this flag set to true and CompressImages is true images will be resized if image resoultion is greater then specified MaxResolution parameter.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.ImageQuality
member.summary: Specifies level of image compression when CompressIamges flag is used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.MaxResoultion
member.summary: Specifies maximum resolution of images. If image has higher resolition it will be scaled

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.UnembedFonts
member.summary: Make fonts not embedded if set to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Document.OptimizationOptions.RemovePrivateInfo
member.summary: Remove private information (page piece info).

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.AutoFiller
member.summary: Represents a class to receive data from database or other datasource, fills them into the designed fields of the template pdf and at last generates new pdf file or stream. It has two template file input modes:input as a stream or a pdf file. It has four types of output modes:one merged stream, one merged file, many small streams, many small files. It can recieve literal data contained in a System.Data.DataTable.

member.summary: xmp:BaseURL property. The base URL for relative URLs in the document content. If this document contains Internet links, and those links are relative, /// they are relative to this base URL. This property provides a standard way for embedded relative URLs to be interpreted by tools. /// Web authoring tools should set the value based on their notion of where URLs will be interpreted

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege
member.summary: Represents the privileges for accessing Pdf file. Refer to. There are 4 ways using this class: 1.Using predefined privilege directly. 2.Based on a predefined privilege and change some specifical permissions. 3.Based on a predefined privilege and change some specifical Adobe Professional permissions combination. 4.Mixes the way2 and way3.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary:
Compares two objects.
The object to compare with. A signed integer that indicates the relative values of this instance and value. Less than zero this instance is less than value. Zero this instance is equal to value. Greater than zero this instance is greater than value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowPrint
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow print or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowDegradedPrinting
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow degraded printing or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowModifyContents
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow modify contents or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowCopy
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow copy or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowModifyAnnotations
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow modify annotations or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowFillIn
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow fill in forms or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowScreenReaders
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow screen readers or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowAssembly
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow assembly or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.PrintAllowLevel
member.summary: Sets the print level of document's privilege. Just as the Adobe Professional's Printing Allowed settings. 0: None. 1: Low Resolution (150 dpi). 2: High Resolution.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.ChangeAllowLevel
member.summary: Sets the change level of document's privilege. Just as the Adobe Professional's Changes Allowed settings. 0: None. 1: Inserting, Deleting and Rotating pages. 2: Filling in form fields and signing existing signature fields. 3: Commenting, filling in form fields, and signing existing signature fields. 4: Any except extracting pages.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.CopyAllowLevel
member.summary: Sets the copy level of document's privilege. Just as the Adobe Professional's permission settings. 0: None. 1: Enable text access for screen reader devices for the visually impaired. 2: Enable copying of text, images and other content.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.#ctor
M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.FillField(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Fills the field with a valid value according to a fully qualified field name. Before filling the fields, every field's names and its corresponding valid values must be known. Both the fields' name and values are case sensitive. Please note that Aspose.Pdf.Facades supports only full field names and does not work with partial field names in contrast with Aspose.Pdf.Kit; For example if field has full name "Form.Subform.TextField" you should specify full name and not "TextField". You can use FieldNames property to explore existing field names and search required field by its partial name.
member.param: The field's name to be filled.
The field's value which must be a valid value for some fields.
member.returns: true if field is found and filled successfully.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.FillField(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fills the radio box field with a valid index value according to a fully qualified field name. Before filling the fields, only field's name must be known. While the value can be specified by its index. Notice: Only be applied to Radio Box, Combo Box and List Box fields. Please note that Aspose.Pdf.Facades supports only full field names and does not work with partial field names in contrast with Aspose.Pdf.Kit; For example if field has full name "Form.Subform.ListBoxField" you should specify full name and not "ListBoxField". You can use FieldNames property to explore existing field names and search required field by its partial name.
member.param: Name of field to be filled.
member.returns: true if field was found and successfully filled.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.FillField(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fills the check box field with a boolean value. Notice: Only be applied to Check Box. Please note that Aspose.Pdf.Facades supports only full field names and does not work with partial field names in contrast with Aspose.Pdf.Kit; For example if field has full name "Form.Subform.CheckBoxField" you should specify full name and not "CheckBoxField". You can use FieldNames property to explore existing field names and search required field by its partial name.

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); form.FillField("checkboxField", true);

member.param: The field's name to be filled.
A boolean flag: true means to check the box, while false to uncheck it.
member.returns: true if field was found and successfully filled.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.GetButtonOptionCurrentValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the current value for radio button option fields.
member.returns: String value for the current radio group optino. See also

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); Console.WriteLine(form.GetButtonOptionCurrentValue("btnField"));

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.GetButtonOptionValues(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the radio button option fields and related values based on the field name. This method has meaning for radio button groups.
member.returns: Hash table of option values keyed by form item name

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); Console.WriteLine("Full field name is : " + form.GetFullFieldName("textField"));

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter
member.summary: Represents a class to convert data from one format to another format. It can convert the data in fdf/xml/pdf/xfdf to the OLEDB/OdbcDB. It also can convert the data in the OLEDB/OdbcDB to the data in fdf/xml/xfdf. It can convert the fdf to the xml with "hard-named" tag.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ConvertXmlToFdf(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Convert XML import/export form data file into FDF format.
member.param: Source stream which contains XML file.
Destination source where resultant FDF file will be stored.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ConvertFdfToXml(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Convert FDF file into XML.
member.param: Stream which contains FDF to convert.
Source where reuslt XML will be placed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ConvertToDataTable(System.IO.Stream[],Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DataType)
member.summary: Convert files of strems into table.
member.param: Array of source streams in specified format.
Format of data in streams. Valid values are: PDF, FDF, XFDF, XML.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ImportIntoDataBase(System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DataType)
member.summary: Imports data from table into database.
member.param: Type of database connection: OLEDB or ODBC.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ExportFromDataBase(System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DataType)
member.summary: Exports data from database into table.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ConvertToStreams(System.IO.Stream[],Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DataType)
member.summary: Convert data in table into streams.
member.param: Streams where data will be stored.
Type of stored data. Valid values are: XML, FDF, XFDF.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ConverToStreams(System.IO.Stream[],Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DataType)
member.summary: This method is obsolete. Please use ConvertToStreams() instead.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.Table
member.summary: Gets or sets the middle data container, one DataTable. It must be defined before converting data from one format to another format. The Columns and TableName of the DataTable should be defined. The TableName is the name of the Table in the database. Every column's ColumnName is the qualified field name of the pdf. Every column's Caption is the column name of table in the database. If the field name is the same as the table column name, the Caption need not specified.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.CreateMissingField
member.summary: ConvertToDataTable will create required field if it does not exists in Table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ReplaceExistingTable
member.summary: ImportIntoDatabase will drop existing table and create new table if this property set to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ClearTableBeforeExport
member.summary: ExportFromData will clear table before data export.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.CreateMissingTable
member.summary: ImportIntoDatabase will create table if it does not exists.

member.returns: true if URL for button was successfully set.

example.code: FormEditor formEditor = new FormEditor("PdfForm.pdf", "FormEditor_SetSubmitUrl.pdf"); formEditor.SetSubmitUrl("btnSubmit", "www.mysite.com");

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormEditor.SetFieldLimit(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets maximum character count of the text field.

member.returns: true if field limit was successfully set.

example.code: FormEditor formEditor = new FormEditor("PdfForm.pdf", "FormEditor_SetFieldLimit.pdf"); formEditor.SetFieldLimit("textField", 15);

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormEditor.SetFieldCombNumber(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets number of combs for a regular single-line text field (the field is automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of combNumber parameter).
member.param: The number of combs to divide the field into.

example.code: FormEditor formEditor = new FormEditor("PdfWithAcroForm.pdf", "FormEditor_SetFieldComb.pdf")); formEditor.SetFieldCombNumber("textCombField", 5);

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormEditor.MoveField(System.String,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set new position of field.
member.param: Name of field which must be moved.
Abscissa of the lower-left corner of the field.
Ordinate of the lower-left coerner of the field.
Abscissa of the upper-right corner of the field.
Ordinate of the upper-right corner of the field.
member.returns: true if field position was changed successfully.

example.code: FormEditor formEditor = new FormEditor("PdfForm.pdf", "FormEditor_MoveField.pdf"); formEditor.MoveField("textField", 20.5f, 20.3f, 120.6f, 40.8f);

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormEditor.CopyInnerField(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies an existing field to the same position in specified page number. A new document will be produced, which contains everything the source document has except for the newly copied field.
member.param: The old fully qualified field name.
The new fully qualified field name. If null, it will be set as fieldName + "~".
The number of page to hold the new field. If -1, new field will be copid to the same page as old one hosted.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormEditor.CopyInnerField(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Copies an existing field to a new position specified by both page number and ordinates. A new document will be produced, which contains everything the source document has except for the newly copied field.
member.param: The old fully qualified field name.
The new fully qualified field name. If null, it will be set as fieldName + "~".
The number of page to hold the new field. If -1, new field will be copid to the same page as old one hosted.
The abscissa of the new field. If -1, the abscissa will be equaled to the original one.
The ordinate of the new field. If -1, the ordinate will be equaled to the original one.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormEditor.CopyOuterField(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copies an existing field from one PDF document to another document with original page number and ordinates. Notice: Only for AcroForm fields (excluding radio box).
member.param: The name of PDF document which containes the field to be copied.
The original fully qualified field name.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormEditor.CopyOuterField(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies an existing field from one PDF document to another document with specified page number and original ordinates. Notice: Only for AcroForm fields (excluding radio box).
member.param: The name of PDF document which containes the field to be copied.
The original fully qualified field name.
The number of page to hold the new field. If -1, new field will be copid to the same page as old one hosted.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormEditor.CopyOuterField(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Copies an existing field from one PDF document to another document with specified page number and ordinates. Notice: Only for AcroForm fields (excluding radio box).
member.param: The name of PDF document which containes the field to be copied.
The original fully qualified field name.
The number of page to hold the new field. If -1, new field will be copid to the same page as old one hosted.
The abscissa of the new field. If -1, the abscissa will be equaled to the original one.
The ordinate of the new field. If -1, the ordinate will be equaled to the original one.

example.code: FormEditor formEditor = new FormEditor("PdfForm.pdf", "PdfForm_updated.pdf"); formEditor.CopyOuterField("source.pdf", "textField" , 2, 100, 200);

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize
member.summary: Defines different key sizes which can be used to encrypt pdf documents.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize.x40
member.summary: 40 bit key. Such key size is used with RC4 algorithm and provides low level of security. Nevertheless old versions of pdf documents can be encrypted only with such keys (v. 1.3 and lower);

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize.x128
member.summary: 128 bit key. Both RC4 and AES algorithms can use such key size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize.x256
member.summary: 256 bit key. Such key size can be used only with AES and is recognized with the last Adobe Reader versions (starting from v.9).

member.summary: Creates line annotation.
member.param: The annotation rectangle defining the location of the annotation on the page.
The starting horizontal coordinate of the line.
The starting vertical coordinate of the line.
The ending horizontal coordinate of the line.
The ending vertical coordinate of the line.
The number of original page where the annotation will be created.
The border width in points. If this value is 0 no border is drawn. Default value is 1.
The border style specifying the width and dash pattern to be used in drawing the line. This value can be: "S" (Solid), "D" (Dashed), "B" (Beveled), "I" (Inset), "U" (Underline).
A dash array defining a pattern of dashes and gaps to be used in drawing a dashed border. If it is used, borderSyle must be accordingly set to "D".

An array of two values respectively specifying the beginning and ending style of the drawing line. The values can be: "Square", "Circle", "Diamond", "OpenArrow", "ClosedArrow", "None", "Butt", "ROpenArrow", "RClosedArrow", "Slash".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfExtractor.ExtractImageMode

To extract actually shown images ExtractImageMode.ActuallyUsed mode should be used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfExtractor.IsBidi
member.summary: Is true when text has hebriew or arabic symbols. This case must be specially considered because string functions change their behaviour and start process text from right to left (except numbers and other non text chars).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfExtractor.Resolution
member.summary: Set or gets resolution for extracted images. Default value is 150. Images which have greater resolution value are more clear. However increasing resolution value results in increasing time and memory needed to extract images. Usually to get clear image it's enough to set resolution to 150 or 300.
