member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.Concatenate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Merges two Pdf documents into a new Pdf document with pages in alternate ways and fill the blank places with blank pages. e.g.: document1 has 5 pages: p1, p2, p3, p4, p5. document2 has 3 pages: p1', p2', p3'. Merging the two Pdf document will produce the result document with pages:p1, p1', p2, p2', p3, p3', p4, blankpage, p5, blankpage.

example.code: PdfFileEditor pfe = new PdfFileEditor(); pfe.Concatenate("src1.pdf", "src2.pdf", "blank.pdf", "dest.pdf");

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.Concatenate(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Merges two Pdf documents into a new Pdf document with pages in alternate ways and fill the blank places with blank pages. e.g.: document1 has 5 pages: p1, p2, p3, p4, p5. document2 has 3 pages: p1', p2', p3'. Merging the two Pdf document will produce the result document with pages:p1, p1', p2, p2', p3, p3', p4, blankpage, p5, blankpage.
member.param: The Pdf Stream with blank page

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.MakeNUp(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Makes N-Up document from the two input PDF files to outputFile. Each page of outputFile will contain two pages, one page is from the first input file and another is from the second input file. The two pages are piled up horizontally.
member.param: Output pdf file path and name.
member.returns: boolean - True for success, or false.

example.code: PdfFileEditor pfe = new PdfFileEditor(); pfe.MakeNUp("input1.pdf", "input2.pdf", "output.pdf");

member.returns: boolean - True for success, or false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.MakeNUp(System.String[],System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes N-Up document from the multi input PDF files to outputFile. Each page of outputFile will contain multi pages, which are combination with pages in the input files of the same page number. The multi pages piled up horizontally if isSidewise is true and piled up vertically if isSidewise is false.
member.param: Output pdf file path and name.
Piled up way, true for horizontally and flase for vertically.
member.returns: boolean - True for success, or false.

example.code: PdfFileEditor pfe = new PdfFileEditor(); pfe.MakeNUp(new string[] { "input1.pdf", "input2.pdf", "input3.pdf" }, "output.pdf", false);

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.MakeNUp(System.IO.Stream[],System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes N-Up document from the multi input PDF streams to outputStream. Each page of outputStream will contain multi pages, which are combination with pages in the input streams of the same page number. The multi-pages piled up horizontally if isSidewise is true and piled up vertically if isSidewise is false.
member.param: Output pdf stream. Piled up way, true for horizontally and flase for vertically
member.returns: boolean - True for success, or false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.MakeNUp(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,Aspose.Pdf.PageSize)
member.summary: Makes N-Up document from the input file to outputFile.
member.param: Input pdf file path and name.
Output pdf file path and name.
The page size of the output pdf file.
member.returns: boolean - True for success, or false.

example.code: PdfFileEditor pfe = new PdfFileEditor(); pfe.MakeNUp("input.pdf", "output.pdf", 3, 3, PageSize.A4);

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ConversionLog
member.summary: Gets log of conversion process.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.MergeDuplicateLayers
member.summary: Optional contents of concatentated documents with equal names will be merged into one layer in resulstant document if this property is true. Else, layers with equal names will be save as different layers in resultant document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.CopyOutlines
member.summary: If true then outlines will be copied.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.CopyLogicalStructure
member.summary: If true then logical structure of the file is copied when concatenation is performed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.MergeDuplicateOutlines
member.summary: If true, duplicate outlines are merged.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.PreserveUserRights
member.summary: If true, user rights of first document are applied to concatenated document. User rights of all other documents are ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.IncrementalUpdates
member.summary: If true, incremental updates are made during concatenation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.OptimizeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets optimization flag. Equal resource streams in resultant file are merged into one PDF object if this flag set. This allows to decrease resultant file size but may cause slower execution and larger memory requirements. Default value: false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.CorruptedItems
P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.CorruptedFileAction
member.summary: This property defines behavior when concatenating process met corrupted file. Possible values are: StopWithError and ConcatenateIgnoringCorrupted.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Sets owner's password if the source input Pdf file is encrypted. This property is not implemented yet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.AllowConcatenateExceptions
member.summary: If set to true, exceptions are thrown if error occured. Else excetion are not thrown and methods return false if failed.

example.code: PdfFileEditor pfe = new PdfFileEditor(); pfe.AllowConcatenatedException = true;

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ConvertTo
member.summary: Sets PDF file format. Result file will be saved in specified file format. If this property is not specified then file will be save in default PDF format without conversion.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.CloseConcatenatedStreams
member.summary: If set to true, streams are closed after operation.

example.code: PdfFileEditor pfe = new PdfFileEditor(); pfe.CloseConcatenatedStreams = true;

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.UniqueSuffix
member.summary: Format of the suffix which is added to field name to make it unique when forms are concatenated. This string must contain %NUM% substring which will be replaced with numbers. For example if UniqueSuffix = "ABC%NUM%" then for field "fieldName" names will be: fieldNameABC1, fieldNameABC2, fieldNameABC3 etc.

example.code: PdfFileEditor ed = new PdfFileEditor(); ed.UniqueSuffix = "_%NUM%";

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.KeepFieldsUnique
member.summary: If true then field names will be made unique when forms are concatenated. Suffixes will be added to field names, suffix template may be specified in UniqueSuffix property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.UseDiskBuffer
member.summary: If this option used then destination document will be saved on disk periodically and further concatenation will appllied to it as incremental updates.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ConcatenationPacketSize
member.summary: Number of documents concatenated before new incremental update was made during concatenation when UseDiskBuffer is set to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.LastException
member.summary: Gets last occured exception. May be used to check the reason of failure when AllowconcatenateExceptions = false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ConcatenateCorruptedFileAction
member.summary: Action performed when corrupted file was met in concatenation process.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ConcatenateCorruptedFileAction.StopWithError
member.summary: If corrupted file was met, then stop concatentation process and return error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ConcatenateCorruptedFileAction.ConcatenateIgnoringCorrupted
member.summary: If corrupted file was met, then don't stop concatenation and don't process corrupted file. List of corrupted files is accessible in Failures property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ConcatenateCorruptedFileAction.ConcatenateIgnoringCorruptedObjects
member.summary: When corrupted object is met in source document, process will not stopped and corrupted object only is ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.CorruptedItem
member.summary: Class which provides information about corrupted files in time of concatenation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.CorruptedItem.Index
member.summary: Index of corrupted file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.CorruptedItem.Exception
member.summary: Exception thrown for this file which indicates problem with the file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ContentsResizeValue.IsPercent

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ContentsResizeParameters
member.summary: Class for specifing page resize parameters. Allow to set the following parameters: Size of result page (width, height) in default space units or in percents of initial pages size; Left, Top, Bottom and Right margins in default space units or in percents of initial page size; Some values may be left null for automatic calculation. These values will be calculated from rest of page size after calculation explicitly specified values. For example: if page width = 100 and new page width specified 60 units then left and right margins are automatically calculated: (100 - 60) / 2 = 15. This class is used in ResizeContents method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.ContentsResizeParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Creates resize parameters where al values are set to "auto". Later margins and contents size may be specified if required.

members.member:
Creates resize parameters with specified margin values and contents size.
Left margin value. Contents width. Right margin. Top margin. Contents height. Bottom margin. Empty values means that corresponding value calculated automatically

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity
member.summary: Represents encrypting or decrypting a Pdf file with owner or user password, changing the security setting and password.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initialize the object of PdfFileSecurity with input and output stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the object of PdfFileSecurity with input and output file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize the object of PdfFileSecurity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.EncryptFile(System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize)
member.summary: Encrypts Pdf file with userpassword and ownerpassword and sets the document's privileges to access. The user password and the owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the input owner password is null or empty.
member.param: KeySize.x40 for 40 bits encryption, KeySize.x128 for 128 bits encryption and KeySize.x256 for 256 bits encryption.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass", "ownerpass", DocumentPrivilege.Print, KeySize.x256);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass", "ownerpass", DocumentPrivilege.Print, KeySize.x256)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.EncryptFile(System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Algorithm)
member.summary: Encrypts Pdf file with userpassword and ownerpassword and sets the document's privileges to access. The user password and the owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the input owner password is null or empty. There are 6 possible combinations of KeySize and Algorithm values. However (KeySize.x40, Algorithm.AES) and (KeySize.x256, Algorithm.RC4) are invalid and corresponding exception will be raised if kit encounters this combination.
member.param: KeySize.x40 for 40 bits encryption, KeySize.x128 for 128 bits encryption and KeySize.x256 for 256 bits encryption.
Algorithm.AES to encrypt using AES algorithm or Algorithm.RC4 for RC4 encryption.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass","ownerpass",DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256,Algorithm.AES);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass","ownerpass",DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256,Algorithm.AES)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.DecryptFile(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts an encrypted Pdf document by owner password. If the document hasn't owner password, it is allow to use user password.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0404.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.DecryptFile("ownerpass");
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0404.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.DecryptFile("ownerpass")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.SetPrivilege(Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege)
member.summary: Sets Pdf file security with empty user/owner passwords. The owner password will be added by a random string.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0405.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.SetPrivilege(DocumentPrivilege.Print);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..1\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0405.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.SetPrivilege(DocumentPrivilege.Print)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.SetPrivilege(System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege)
member.summary: Sets Pdf file security with original password.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0405.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.SetPrivilege(userPassword, ownerPassword, DocumentPrivilege.Print);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..1\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0405.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.SetPrivilege(userPassword, ownerPassword, DocumentPrivilege.Print)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.ChangePassword(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the user password and owner password by owner password, keeps the original security settings. The new user password and the new owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the new owner password is null or empty.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0406.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0407.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner");
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0406.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.ChangePassword(System.String,System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize)
member.summary: Changes the user password and password by owner password, allows to reset Pdf documnent security. The new user password and the new owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the new owner password is null or empty.
member.param: KeySize.x40 for 40 bits encryption, KeySize.x128 for 128 bits encryption and KeySize.x256 for 256 bits encryption.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0407.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner", DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0407.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner", DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.ChangePassword(System.String,System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Algorithm)
member.summary: Changes the user password and password by owner password, allows to reset Pdf documnent security. The new user password and the new owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the new owner password is null or empty. There are 6 possible combinations of KeySize and Algorithm values. However (KeySize.x40, Algorithm.AES) and (KeySize.x256, Algorithm.RC4) are invalid and corresponding exception will be raised if kit encounters this combination.
member.param: KeySize.x40 for 40 bits encryption, KeySize.x128 for 128 bits encryption and KeySize.x256 for 256 bits encryption.
Algorithm.AES to encrypt using AES algorithm or Algorithm.RC4 for RC4 encryption.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0407.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner", DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256,Algorithm.AES);

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSignature.Sign(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Aspose.Pdf.Forms.Signature)
member.summary: Sign the document with the given type signature.
member.param: The page number on which signature is made.
The type of the signature, could be PKCS1, PKCS7 and PKCS7Detached. Such data as signature reason, contact and location must be already present in this object (see corresponding properties).

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSignature.Sign(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Forms.Signature)
member.summary: Sign the document with the given type signature which is placed in already presented signature field. Before signing signature field must be empty, i.e. field must not contain signature dictionary. Thus pdf document already has signature field, you should not supply the place to stamp the signature, corresponding page and rectangle are taken from signature field which is found by signature name (see SigName parameter).
member.param: The name of the signature field.
The type of the signature, could be PKCS1, PKCS7 and PKCS7Detached.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSignature.Sign(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Aspose.Pdf.Forms.Signature)
member.summary: Sign the document with the given type signature which is placed in already presented signature field. Before signing pdf document should already has signature field, corresponding page and rectangle are taken from signature field which is found by signature name (see SigName parameter).
member.param: The page number on which signature is made.
The name of the signature field.
The type of the signature, could be PKCS1, PKCS7 and PKCS7Detached.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = TestPath + "blankWithSignature.pdf"; string outFile = TestPath + "signature.pdf"; PKCS7 sig = new PKCS7("certificate.pfx", "password"); PdfFileSignature pdfSign = new PdfFileSignature(inFile); System.Drawing.Rectangle rect = new System.Drawing.Rectangle(100, 100, 100, 100); pdfSign.SignatureAppearance = TestPath + "butterfly.jpg" pdfSign.Sign(1, "Signature1", "ReasonToTest", "ContactMe", "SomeLocation", true, rect, sig); pdfSign.Save(outFile);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = TestPath & "blankWithSignature.pdf" Dim outFile As String = TestPath & "signature.pdf" Dim sig As PKCS7 = new PKCS7("certificate.pfx", "password") Dim pdfSign = new PdfFileSignature(inFile, outFile) pdfSign.SignatureAppearance = TestPath & "butterfly.jpg" pdfSign.Sign("Signature1", "ReasonToTest", "ContactMe", "SomeLocation", true, rect, sig) pdfSign.Save(outFile)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSignature.Sign(System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Forms.Signature)
member.summary: Sign the document with the given type signature which is placed in already presented signature field. Before signing signature field must be empty, i.e. field must not contain signature dictionary. Thus pdf document already has signature field, you should not supply the place to stamp the signature, corresponding page and rectangle are taken from signature field which is found by signature name (see SigName parameter). Such data as signature reason, contact and location must be provided by corresponding properties of the Signature object sig.
member.param: The name of the signature field.
The type of the signature, could be PKCS1 (Pkcs1Signature object), PKCS7 and PKCS7 detached (Pkcs7Signature object)

member.returns: If the document is being certified, than returns access permissions value; otherwise, is thrown.

member.summary: Represents a class to view or print a pdf.

member.summary: Initializes new object.

member.summary: Initializes new object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.String)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf file. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf stream. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.
member.param: The pdf stream to be opened and printed..

example.code:
[C#] PdfViewer viewer = new PdfViewer(); viewer.AutoResize = true; //print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true; //print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintLargePdf(new MemoryStream(File.ReadAllBytes(@"d:\test.pdf"))); viewer.ClosePdfFile();
[VisualBasic] Dim viewer As PdfViewer = new PdfViewer(); viewer.AutoResize = true 'print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true 'print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintLargePdf(new MemoryStream(File.ReadAllBytes(@"d:\test.pdf"))) viewer.ClosePdfFile()

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.String,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf file with specified printer settings. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.IO.Stream,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf stream with specified printer settings. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.
member.param: The pdf stream to be opened and printed..

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.String,System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf file with specified page settings and printer settings. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.IO.Stream,System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)

member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.
member.param: The pdf stream to be opened and printed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintDocumentWithSetup
member.summary: Prints the Pdf document with a setup dialog. Choose a printer using the dialog.

example.code:
[C#] PdfViewer viewer = new PdfViewer(); viewer.OpenPdfFile(@"d:\test.pdf"); viewer.AutoResize = true; //print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true; //print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintDocumentWithSetup(); viewer.ClosePdfFile();
[VisualBasic] Dim viewer As PdfViewer = new PdfViewer() viewer.OpenPdfFile(@"d:\test.pdf") viewer.AutoResize = true 'print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true 'print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintDocumentWithSetup() viewer.ClosePdfFile()

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintDocumentWithSettings(System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Prints the Pdf document with settings. If the document size is not complatible to page size, pdf.kit will extend it to fit page size.
member.param: The page setting of the printing document.
The printer setting of the printing document.

example.remarks: printerSettings object is used to print the document. pageSettings.PrinterSettings object is ignored.

member.param: The printer setting of the printing document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintAsImage
member.summary: Sets or gets a mode for PdfViewer to print as image.
member.remarks:
If true prints always as image (generates image that is printed) If false prints directly to device if all features are supported. In case document contains non-supported features the system may automatically decide to print as image.
Default falue is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Stamp.Rotate
member.summary: Sets or gets the rotation of stamp content according values. Note. This property is for set angles which are multiples of 90 degrees (0, 90, 180, 270 degrees). To set arbitrary angle use RotateAngle property. If angle set by ArbitraryAngle is not multiple of 90 then Rotate property returns Rotation.None.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags
member.summary: A set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Default
member.summary: Default value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Invisible
member.summary: If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such an unknown annotation using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Hidden
member.summary: If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available. In cases where screen space is limited, the ability to hide and show annotations selectively can be used in combination with appearance streams to display auxiliary pop-up information similar in function to online help systems.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Print
member.summary: If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen. This can be useful, for example, for annotations representing interactive pushbuttons, which would serve no meaningful purpose on the printed page.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoZoom
member.summary: If set, do not scale the annotations appearance to match the magnification of the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation rectangle) remains fixed, regardless of the page magnification.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoRotate
member.summary: If set, do not rotate the annotations appearance to match the rotation of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle remains in a fixed location on the page, regardless of the page rotation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoView
member.summary: If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag) but should be considered hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags) but should not respond to mouse clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is ignored for widget annotations; its function is subsumed by the ReadOnly flag of the associated form field.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Locked
member.summary: If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to the annotations contents, such as the value of a form field.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ToggleNoView
member.summary: If set, invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events. A typical use is to have an annotation that appears only when a mouse cursor is held over it.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.LockedContents
member.summary: If set, do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties, such as position and size.

member.summary: The state model corresponding to state of annotation.

member.summary: Represents explicit destination that displays the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and topentirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. A null value for any of the parameters may result in unpredictable behavior.

member.summary: If clear, the Fields array specifies which fields to include in the submission.

member.summary: If set, all fields designated by the Fields array and the Include/Exclude flag shall be submitted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.ExportFormat
member.summary: If set, field names and values shall be submitted in HTML Form format.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.GetMethod
member.summary: If set, field names and values shall be submitted using an HTTP GET request.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.SubmitCoordinates
member.summary: If set, the coordinates of the mouse click that caused the submit-form action shall be transmitted as part of the form data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.Xfdf
member.summary: If set, field names and values shall be submitted as XFDF.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.IncludeAppendSaves
member.summary: If set, the submitted FDF file shall include the contents of all incremental updates.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.IncludeAnnotations
member.summary: If set, the submitted FDF file shall include includes all markup annotations in the underlying PDF document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.SubmitPdf
member.summary: If set, the document shall be submitted as PDF, using the MIME content type application/pdf.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.CanonicalFormat
member.summary: If set, any submitted field values representing dates shall be converted to the standard format.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.ExclNonUserAnnots
member.summary: If set, it shall include only those markup annotations whose T entry matches the name of the current user.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.ExclFKey
member.summary: If set, the submitted FDF shall exclude the F entry.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.SubmitFormAction.EmbedForm
member.summary: If set, the F entry of the submitted FDF shall be a file specification containing an embedded file stream representing the PDF file from which the FDF is being submitted.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.License.Embedded
member.summary: License number was added as embedded resource.

member.summary: Accepts visitor object to process operator.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Operator.SetDash.ToString
member.summary: Gets operator string representation.
member.returns: [x1 x2] y d, where x1 - dash length, x2 - gap length, y - phase.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Operator.SetDash.Pattern
member.summary: Dash pattern. Arrays elements shall be numbers that specify the lengths of alternating dashes and gaps. In case of one element array dash and gap lengths are equal.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Operator.SetDash.Phase
member.summary: Dash phase. Before beginning to stroke a path, the dash array shall be cycled through, adding up the lengths of dashes and gaps. When the accumulated length equals the value specified by the dash phase, stroking of the path shall begin, and the dash array shall be used cyclically from that point onward.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextStamp.TreatYIndentAsBaseLine
member.summary: Defines coordinate origin for placing text. If TreatYIndentAsBaseLine = true (default when Draw = true) YIndent value will be treated as text base line. If TreatYIndentAsBaseLine = false (default when Draw = false) YIndent value will be treated as bottom (descent line) of text.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextStamp.WordWrap
member.summary: Defines word wrap. If this property set to true and Width value specified, text will be broken in the several lines to fit into specified width. Default value: false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextStamp.Justify
member.summary: Defines text justification. If this property is set to true, both left and right edges of the text are aligned. Default value: false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextStamp.Scale
member.summary: Defines scaling of the text. If this property is set to true and Width value specified, text will be scaled in order to fit to specified width.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions
member.summary: This enum represents user's permissions for a pdf.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.PrintDocument
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 2) Print the document. (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Print the document (possibly not at the highest quality level, depending on whether is also set).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.ModifyContent
member.summary: Modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by , , and 11.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.ExtractContent
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 2) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document, including extracting text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes). (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document by operations other than that controlled by .

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.ModifyTextAnnotations
member.summary: Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields, and, if is also set, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.FillForm
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), even if is clear.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.ExtractContentWithDisabilities
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.AssembleDocument
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), even if is clear.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.PrintingQuality
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated. When this bit is clear (and bit 3 is set), printing is limited to a low-level representation of the appearance, possibly of degraded quality.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.RenderingOptions.ConvertFontsToUnicodeTTF
member.summary: Indicates that all fonts will be converted to TTF unicode versions. That is useful for compatibility reasons and to optimize font usage, cause every new TTF font will have not all the symbols from source font, but only symbols which are used in text.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.RenderingOptions.UseFontHinting
member.summary: Usage of this flag turn on font hinting mechanism. Font hinting is the use of mathematical instructions to adjust the display of an outline font. In some cases turning this flag on may solve problems with text legibility. At current moment usage of this flag could give effect only for TTF fonts, if these fonts are used in source document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Text.TextFragmentState
member.summary: Represents a text state of a text fragment.
member.remarks:
Provides a way to change following properties of the text: font ( property) font size ( property) font style ( property) foreground color ( property) background color ( property)
Note that changing properties may change inner collection because TextFragment is an aggregate object and it may rearrange internal segments or merge them into single segment. If your requirement is to leave the collection unchanged, please change inner segments individually.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Text.TextSegment
member.summary: Represents segment of Pdf text.
member.remarks:
In a few words, objects are children of object.
In details:
Text of pdf document in is represented by two basic objects: and
The differences between them is mostly context-dependent.
Let's consider following scenario. User searches text "hello world" to operate with it, change it's properties, look etc.
Document doc = new Document(docFile); TextFragmentAbsorber absorber = new TextFragmentAbsorber("hello world"); doc.Pages[1].Accept(absorber);
Phisycally pdf text's representation is very complex. The text "hello world" may consist of several phisycally independent text segments.
The Aspose.Pdf text model basically establishes that object provides single logic operation set over physical objects set that represent user's query.
In text search scenario, is logical "hello world" text representation, and object collection represents all physical segments that construct "hello world" text object.
So, is close to logical text representation. And is close to physical text representation.
Obviously each object may have it's own font, coloring, positioning properties.
provides simple way to change text with it's properties: set font, set font size, set font color etc. Meanwhile objects are accessible and users are able to operate with objects independently.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.DocSaveOptions.Mode
member.summary: Recognition mode.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.DocSaveOptions.RelativeHorizontalProximity
member.summary: In Pdf words may be innerly represented with operators that prints words by independently printing their letters or syllables. So, to detect words sometimes we need detect groups of independent chars that are in fact words. This setting defines width of space between text elements(letters, syllables) that must be treated as distance between words during recognition of words in source PDF. (presence of empty space at least with this width between letters means that textual elements pertain to different words). It's normed to font size - 1.0 means 100% of supposed word's font size. ATTENTION!It's used only in cases when source PDF contains specific rarely used fonts for which optimal value cannot be calculated from font. So, in vast majority of cases this parameter changes nothing in result document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.DocSaveOptions.RecognizeBullets
member.summary: Switch on the recognition of bullets

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.DocSaveOptions.Format
member.summary: Output format

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.DocSaveOptions.RecognitionMode
member.summary: Allows to control how a PDF document is converted into a word processing document.

remarks.para: Use the mode when the resulting document is not goining to be heavily edited futher. Textboxes are easy to modify when there is not a lot to do.

Use the mode when the output document needs further editing. Paragraphs and texlines in the flow mode allow easy modification of text, but unupported formatting objects will look worse than in the mode.

summary.para: This mode is fast and good for maximally preserving original look of the PDF file, but editability of the resulting document could be limited.

Every visually grouped block of text int the original PDF file is converted into a textbox in the resulting document. This achieves maximal resemblance of the output document to the original PDF file. The output document will look good, but it will consist entirely of textboxes and it could makes further editing of the document in Microsoft Word quite hard.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.DocSaveOptions.RecognitionMode.Flow
member.summary: Full recognition mode, the engine performs grouping and multi-level analysis to restore the original document author's intent and produce a maximally editable document. The downside is that the output document might look different from the original PDF file.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.ExplicitDestinationType
member.summary: Enumerates the types of explicit destinations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.ExplicitDestinationType.XYZ
member.summary: Display the page with the coordinates (left,top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.ExplicitDestinationType.Fit
member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.ExplicitDestinationType.FitH
member.summary: Display the page with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.ExplicitDestinationType.FitV
member.summary: Display the page with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.ExplicitDestinationType.FitR
member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and topentirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the rectangle within the window in the other dimension. A null value for any of the parameters may result in unpredictable behavior.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.ExplicitDestinationType.FitB
member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.ExplicitDestinationType.FitBH
member.summary: Display the page with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Annotations.ExplicitDestinationType.FitBV
member.summary: Display the page with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.summary: Pdf document was opened using change permissions password (full access).

member.summary: Pdf document is password protected but both user and owner passwords are not empty and none of the passwords was defined or supplied password was incorrect. So it impossible to deduce the type of the password.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Structure.NamespaceDoc

member.summary: (Optional; PDF1.4) A language specifying the natural language for all text in the structure element except where overridden by language specifications for nested structure elements or marked content.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Structure.Element.ActualText
member.summary: (Optional; PDF1.4) Text that is an exact replacement for the structure element and its children. This replacement text (which should apply to as small a piece of content as possible) is useful when extracting the documents contents in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Structure.Element.Alt

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.XslFoLoadOptions.ParsingErrorsHandlingTypes
member.summary: Source XSLFO document can contain formatting errors. This enum enumerates possible strategies of handling of such formatting errors

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.XslFoLoadOptions.ParsingErrorsHandlingTypes.TryIgnore
member.summary: In this case converter will be instructed to try proceed with conversion and ignore found formatting errors. In this case success not guaranteed, serious problems can occure later in converter, anf in suck case will be thrown exception with list of found formatting errors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.XslFoLoadOptions.ParsingErrorsHandlingTypes.ThrowExceptionImmediately
member.summary: In this case conversion will be stopped immediately and exception will be thrown immediately after detecting of first formatting error

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.XslFoLoadOptions.ParsingErrorsHandlingTypes.InvokeCustomHandler
member.summary: This is the most agile method - custom code must supply (in WarningCallback property) special handler that will be called when formatting error detected. That handler can f.e. log or count errors etc and will supply decision whether processing can be continued for this or that error.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Table.ImportArray(System.Object[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Imports one-dimensional array of data into table. Import goes one cell per each array's item and starts from row and column defined in parameters. During import, if detected that necessary rows are still absent(i.e. target table is too small to absorb all data), necessary rows will be created
member.param: imported data, nulls will be imported as empty strings
define number of first target row in target table from wich import will start. If amount of rows in target table less then required, missing rows will be created first.
specifies number of first target column in target table , column must be present in target table before start of import
If 'isLeftColumnsFilled'=false, then in second and all subsequent filled rows cells that are on the left hand from firstFilledColumn will be skipped

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Table.ImportDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Imports data from System.Data.DataTable into Aspose.Pdf.Table
member.param: specifies whether column names will be imported as first row
specifies zero based number of first row in target table from which import will start, if row with such number(and some previous rows) are absent in target table, they will be created first
specifies number of first target column in target table , column must be present in target table before start of import

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Table.ImportDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Byte,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Imports a object into the table.
member.param: Specifies whether the column names of the source datatable will be imported as first row.
specifies zero based number of first row in target table from which import will start, if row with such number(and some previous rows) are absent in target table, they will be created first
specifies number of first target column in target table , column must be present in target table before start of import
Maximum amount of rows to be imported from source table.
Maximum amount of columns to be imported from source table.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Table.ImportDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Imports a object, but not as whole entity. Only specified rows and columns are imported.
member.param: The array of numbers of rows in source object that must be imported. List must be not null and must contain only numbers of existing rows, otherwise exception will be thrown.
The array of numbers of columns in source object that must be imported. List must be not null and must contain only numbers of existing columns, otherwise exception will be thrown.
The zero based row number of the first cell in targer table from which import will start. If target table does not contain that row, it (and all previous if necessary) will be created
The zero based column number of the first cell in targer table from which import will start. The target table must contain that column befor import starts, otherwise exception will be thrown.
Specifies whether the column names of source datatable will be imported as first row.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Table.ImportDataView(System.Data.DataView,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Imports a object's data into the table.
member.param: Indicates whether the column names will be imported as first row.
The zero based row number of the first cell in targer table from which import will start. If target table does not contain that row, it (and all previous if necessary) will be created

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Artifact.BeginUpdates
member.summary: Start delated updates. Use this feature if you need make several changes to the same artifact to improve performance. Usually artifact operators are changed anytime when artifact property was changed. This causes changing of page contents everytime when artifact was changed. To avoid this effect put all artifact updates between StartUpdates/SaveUpdates calls. This allows to change page contents only once.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Artifact.SaveUpdates
member.summary: Saves all updates in artifact which were made after BeginUpdates() call.

member.summary: Contains options for loading/importing EPUB file into pdf document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.EpubLoadOptions.MarginsAreaUsageMode
member.summary: Represents mode of usage of margins area - defines treatement of instructions (if any) of CSS of imported document related to usage of margins.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.EpubLoadOptions.PageSizeAdjustmentMode
member.summary:
ATTENTION! The feature implemented but did not put yet to public API since blocker issue in OSHARED layer revealed for sample document.
Represents mode of usage of page size during conversion. Formats (like HTML, EPUB etc), usually have float design, so, it allows to fit required pagesize. But sometimes content has specified horizontal positions or size that does not allow put content into required page size. In such case we can define what should be done in this case (i.e when size of content does not fit required initial page size of result PDF document).

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.EpubLoadOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates default load options for converting EPUB file into pdf document. Default pdf page size - A4 300dpi 2480 X 3508.

member.summary: Creates load options with specified page size.
member.param: Defines pdf page width and height.

member.summary: Gets or sets output page size for import.

member.summary: Gets reference on object that represent marging info.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.SvgSaveOptions
member.summary: Save options for export to SVG format

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.SvgSaveOptions.CustomStrategyOfEmbeddedImagesSaving
member.summary: This field can contain saving strategy that must be used (if present) during conversion for customized handling of created referenced external images files (like embedded BMP or JPEG) embedded into saved SVG. That strategy must process resources and return string that represents desirable URI of saved resource in generated SVG. If processing for this or that file for some reason must be done by converter's code itself, not in custom code, please set in custom code flag 'CustomProcessingCancelled' of 'imageSavingInfo' parameter's variable It signals to converter that all the necessary steps for processing of that resource must be done in converter itself as if there was no any external custom code .

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.SvgSaveOptions.TreatTargetFileNameAsDirectory
member.summary: This options defines whether will be created target directory (if absent yet) with same name as requested output file instead of requested output file itself. It so, that directory will contain all output SVG-images of pages (like described below). If no, output files of pages other then first one will be created exactly in requested directory as main output file, but will contain in file name suffix _[2...n], that is defined by page number, f.e. if You define output file "C:\AsposeTests\output.svg" and output will contain several svg-files of pages, then files of pages will be created also in directory "C:\AsposeTests\" and have names 'output.svg', 'output_2.svg', 'output_3.svg' etc.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.SvgSaveOptions.CompressOutputToZipArchive
member.summary: Specifies whether output will be created as one zip-archive. Please refer comment to 'TreatTargetFileNameAsDirectory' options to see rules of naming of svg-files of pages for multipage source document, that are also applied to zipped set of output files.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.SvgSaveOptions.EmbeddedImagesSavingStrategy
member.summary: To property of such type You can assign delegate created from custom method that implements processing of external saving of image that was extracted from SVG created from PDF and must be saved as external resource during conversion of PDF to HTML. In such case processing (like self-made saving into stream or on disk) can be done in that custom code and that custom code must return path(or any another string without quotemarks) that will be afterwards incorporated into generated SVG instead of original supposed path to that image resource. In such case all the necessary actions for saving of image must be undertaken in code of supplied method, because saving of result in code of converter will be not in use. If processing for this or that file for some reason must be done by converter's code itself, not in custom code, please set in custom code flag 'CustomProcessingCancelled' of 'imageSavingInfo' parameter's variable It signals to converter that all the necessary steps for processing of that resource must be done in converter itself as if there was no any external custom code . represents information about saved image that can be use in custom code must return string that represents URL of image that will be put into SVG

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.SvgSaveOptions.SvgExternalImageType

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.EpubSaveOptions
member.summary: Save options for export to EPUB format

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.EpubSaveOptions.ContentRecognitionMode
member.summary: When PDF file (that usually has fixed layout) is being converted, the conversion engine tries to perform grouping and multi-level analysis to restore the original document author's intent and produce result in flow layout. This property tunes that conversion for this or that desirable method of recognition of content.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.EpubSaveOptions.RecognitionMode
member.summary: When PDF file (that usually has fixed layout) is being converted, the conversion engine tries to perform grouping and multi-level analysis to restore the original document author's intent and produce result in flow layout. This property tunes that conversion for this or that desirable method of recognition of content.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.EpubSaveOptions.RecognitionMode.Flow
member.summary: Full recognition mode, the engine tries to perform grouping and multi-level analysis to restore the original document author's intent and produce xhtml in flow layout.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.EpubSaveOptions.RecognitionMode.PdfFlow
member.summary: The main idea of this conversion is based on saving "natural" order of content rendering that is formed during processing of pdf documents. In the general cases pdf documents keep top-down\left-right rendering order (see attachment directions.png). This assumption allows to create a single-path algorithm that will transform Aps elements that have positions (fixed-layout) into flow formats like HTML,EPUB,DOC. This mode will be especially useful for converting from PDF(APS) into EPUB, because the EPUB format was developed for e-readers like the Kindle or smart-phones. The size of screen those devices usually is less than the size of screen of ordinary PC. Therefore the content of EPUB documents is better to save in the flow format, for correct rendering on screens with different sizes. In this mode every column will be added to the end of previous column this allows to keep the logical structure of transformed document during "pagination" in EPUB readers. This achievement allows correctly render scientific or magazine articles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.EpubSaveOptions.RecognitionMode.Fixed
member.summary: This mode is fast and good for maximally preserving the original look pages, but unfortunately many EPUB readeres don't support xhtml with fixed layout

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.PptxSaveOptions
member.summary: Save options for export to SVG format

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PptxSaveOptions.SlidesAsImages
member.summary: If set to true then all the content is recognized as images (one per page)

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PptxSaveOptions.SeparateImages
member.summary: If set to true then images are separated from all other graphics
